body:
Hello @TomAugspurger! Thanks for submitting the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/common.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/7495d57ae969ffa8da5c679911db47f8919fabbc/pandas/tests/indexes/common.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/datetimelike.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/7495d57ae969ffa8da5c679911db47f8919fabbc/pandas/tests/indexes/datetimelike.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/test_base.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/7495d57ae969ffa8da5c679911db47f8919fabbc/pandas/tests/indexes/test_base.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/test_common.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/7495d57ae969ffa8da5c679911db47f8919fabbc/pandas/tests/indexes/test_common.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/test_numeric.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/7495d57ae969ffa8da5c679911db47f8919fabbc/pandas/tests/indexes/test_numeric.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/test_range.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/7495d57ae969ffa8da5c679911db47f8919fabbc/pandas/tests/indexes/test_range.py) !

> I think test_unique_na can be moved from common.py to test_base.py

done.

> Both test_has_duplicates and test_duplicated in common.py are still using the indices fixture.

hmm yes. As soon as I saw them using `self._holder`, I moved on from those tests. But those are indeed just skipping. I fixed this in aba63dae55c406a7bf5d2ce4dd36e206a03af9dc, if you could double check my work. I *think* that `type(indices)` is just fine for all these tests.

yeah this is ok. we need to finish moving to all fixtures from the inhertence setup of the original (might even be an open issue about this).
